item.description:
It's time for another FREE classical music concert for the fall season!

Tonight, David Loebel, the NEC's associate Director of Orchestras, leads a fascinating program of orchestral works based on dances plus Mendelssohn's "Italian" Symphony. Included will be works from Harbison, Piston, Respighi and Mendelssohn. For more information about this concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/n...

The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert. We usually end up sitting in the back full row of the center floor section, since this affords a good view of the entire orchestra, is open to the ceiling, and is easy to describe and find, but if the balcony is open, I try to grab a section on the left side as it affords a really good view of the orchestra and the acoustics are still amazing.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it--it's near that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.


This evening's program will include:


  • John Harbison: Remembering Gatsby: Foxtrot for Orchestra
  • Walter Piston: The Incredible Flutist: Suite
  • Respighi: Ancient Airs and Dances: Suite II, P.138 listen to the 4th movment here
  • Mendelssohn: Symphony No.4, op.90, A major (Italian) listen to the (very familiar) 1st movement here
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group, either in the left section of the main floor or upstairs to the left-middle balcony section (if it's open.)
item.name: Classical Concert Series: Loebel conducts Harbison, Respighi & Mendelssohn
